title: Hezbollah Claims Shooting Down Israeli Drone
originSummary: Hezbollah claims to have shot down an Israeli combat drone, the Hermes 450, using a surface-to-air missile, in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.
The Israeli Defense Forces confirmed that a military drone experienced an emergency landing, but Israel has not officially responded to Hezbollah's claim.
In response, an Israeli UAV targeted an aluminum plant near Nabatiyeh, causing damage and a fire, escalating tension between Israel and Hezbollah along the border.

title: EDGE Group signs major deals at airshow, secures Dhs239m UAS contract with defence ministry
originSummary: Abu Dhabi-based EDGE Group and its entities have secured significant deals at the Dubai Airshow.
ADASI, an autonomous systems and services company, has signed a Dhs239m contract to supply unmanned aerial systems to the Ministry of Defence.

EDGE has partnered with Calidus to integrate weapon solutions onto aircraft and other platforms, and with Roketsan to explore joint development opportunities for guided artillery and missiles. The group has also signed agreements with EPI, Thales Group, and AR Engineering for various industrial and engineering services.

title: UK Armed Forces Equipment: A Modernized and Adapting Military
originSummary: The UK armed forces recently released their annual report on equipment and formations, providing an overview of their land, maritime, and air capabilities.
The report highlights the UK's naval strength, with 10 submarines and 72 vessels, and mentions the slight decrease in Royal Navy vessels and increase in the Royal Fleet Auxiliary fleet.

The UK armed forces also have a significant number of combat equipment, infantry battalions, fixed-wing aircraft, rotary-wing aircraft, and unmanned aircraft systems, showcasing their modernization and adaptation efforts.

title: GA-ASI Makes History with Drone Takeoff on HMS Prince of Wales
originSummary: General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI) achieved a significant milestone by demonstrating the short takeoff and landing (STOL) capability of its Mojave UAS on the British Royal Navy's HMS Prince of Wales.
The demonstration showcases the potential for unmanned aircraft to be used in naval operations and represents a leap forward in UAS technology.

The Mojave UAS is designed for armed overwatch, attack, and reconnaissance missions and can take off and land on aircraft carriers. Plans to equip the larger MQ-9B aircraft with STOL capability are also underway, further enhancing its versatility.

title: How High Can You Fly Without FAA?
originSummary: The FAA is the regulatory authority for airspace and aviation safety in the US.
The maximum altitude for flying without FAA involvement depends on the aircraft type and airspace classification.
Class G airspace offers more freedom, but caution is necessary to avoid conflicts with other aircraft.

title: Ogun Ex-Governor Proposes Aviation College Bill to Boost Government's Efforts
originSummary: Former governor of Ogun state, Gbenga Daniel, is leading a bill to establish the Federal College of Aviation Technology in Ilara Remo.
The bill aims to complement government efforts and focuses on offering courses in Aircraft Design, Navigation Systems, and UAVs.
The bill has already passed the second reading in the upper chamber and has the potential to provide local skill acquisition and benefits for Ogun residents and Nigerians in the aviation sector.
